messages.message:
Q: Is there a way a customer can copy an existing class?

There's this Q from a customer in Discourse:
https://community.instabase.com/t/is-there-any-way-to-copy-a-class/296

I know we can import prebuilt classes when creating a new class, might a customer be able to add to that list of classes, such as publishing their app in the hub?

If not, I know we have this script to migrate projects between envs:
https://github.com/instabase/aihub-apps-ci-cd-workflows
Do you foresee any harm in attempting to copy an existing class by editing the JSON in the intermediate stage where the project is downloaded from the source and before it's uploaded to the target env?

Do we have a feature request where we can track when a more user-friendly way of doing this might be available?

Not today, but I think this is the most relevant backlog item: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-2823

If it's quite a big class using or modifying that script can work in the interim, just be sure to test it in a safe internal environment first.

Gotcha. I can reply to that post saying that we don't have it as a built-in feature currently, but do have a workaround that their account team could explore with them. I'll then encourage him to reach out to his account team about this.
